fabfreshandfly: I've been in a loving relationship for over 2 years now and I absolutely hate Valentine's Day. I dread this time of year. I had a bad experience as a teenager and every year around this time I try to avoid it but it's everywhere. Even tho my boo is amazing I never really feel good on this day. What I decided to do this year is make it a day of self-care so I can start working on my healing.
celesexuall: Raquel this time of year sucks as for me because my emotional state changes based on what I was going through same time last year. My worth feels so tied to someone who didn’t care enough. Now that it’s over, I’m trying to get my queer love life to take off and it’s not. Again my worth feels tied to the romance of others 😫I’m fed up of wanting so badly something that isn’t coming
seeyalatersimulator: Muva. Where do you draw the line between toxic monogamy and emotionally unavailable partners who aren’t suitable for any type of relationship..poly, mono, even casual? asking for a friend 🙄
comeatmebreaux: At some point I decided that even if I’m single on valentine’s (and I normally am), I can still use it as a day to celebrate self love and my friendships. I’m going out with a group of amazing women on Wednesday for Galentine’s and dinner with my best friend on Friday. Actual Valentine’s will be for me to relax, drink my favorite wine, and remind myself I’m a bad bitch. I got my heart broken last April and am still recovering, and it’s been really hard to not internalize it. I keep asking myself how I was wrong about finding a good partner yet again. Self care has been such a struggle 😩
fox_xx_ie: Ughh prioritizing romantic love always came with the idea of revolving my personal clothing styles around attracting a partner. Like I used to be tomboyish and attracted to men so I felt very conflicted inside, trying to balance the idea of wearing a style that I was most comfortable in and being attracted to straight men who preferred femininity. Not making romantic love such a priority in my life made me feel so much about being tomboyish and also not limiting myself.
perlita_applebum88: @iluvkialee @o_liv_06 I just love reading her shit.
hoelivia_newtonjohn: Understanding that failed relationships aren’t really a failure bc they don’t define me or my worth as a human. Also understanding that failed relationships aren’t an actual failure, they are a shared experience between partners that can inform us about what we deserve/need/want 💖💖
lunariangoddess_: I’ve always struggled to love myself and make myself happy, so one of my biggest struggles has been relying on my partners to fulfill my emotional needs. I’ve relied on my partners to treat me the way I wish I could treat myself. I’ve started to unpack this and notice myself falling in love too quickly and fantasizing about how another person could make my life 10x better and now I stop to think and tell myself that it won’t work. That I have to learn to be happy by myself without validation from others and accept that the way people treat me isn’t my fault. This Valentine’s Day I’m going to eat with my mom because she’s been there since day 1. 💘
simply_hls: I prioritize romantic love by looking at relationships as pass/fail, failing being ended. So I’m working on accepting that relationships can be awesome and then end because they served their purpose and also that they can have levels (not just on/off).
femmmeow: Raquel I love you and your page. I have tried virtually every relationship structure, and whole open/non-monog relationships are definitely harder and require more time and energy, I feel so trapped, stifled, and stagnant in monogamous relationships. I think it is so important to continue talking about the perils of TMC.
_annyma: I posted a long ass message and IG just chooses not to upload? word. basically I said don't believe in monogamy cos that's an antiquated concept from when life expectancy was 30 years and I've reached almost 30 with no man and I'm doing great. having a companion would be nice but I can't be around anybody who doesn't make my life better, platonic or romantic. I've always thought a man would fix my life but now I know that me and my therapist will fix my life and a man will need to complement it. it's a want not a need, like getting a pizza delivered when you're peckish. humans are multifaceted and need different people to serve different parts of us too. the belief that one person can do that is all kinds of wild!
anorthcountrygirl: In the past few years I really prioritized friendship over my SO, in hindsight I was feeling stunted there by not being met emotionally and feeling jealous. Eventually our relationship ended, which was for the best, but in a big way TMC prevented both of us from seeing and enjoying one another. I don’t know how it would have been different if we hadn’t been so pushed by that, but I’m definitely taking the lessons into my next relationship, whenever that is. For now, friends & family are everything for me.
hernameisrocio: I got to a point of asking to myself whether monogamy is for me or not, been through a toxic relationship that is definitely the epitome of a toxic monogamous relationship.
aileenandherfeelings: Ps i saw TMC in full effect in college once during class introductions that included names and a “fun fact”. People would mention knowing 3 languages, traveling abroad, etc.. but the one response with the only “round of applause” (rather loud and unsettling actually in my opinion) was for the person who announced that they were engaged! LOL
floramarpetersen: I appreciate this conversation so much, as someone who is very monogamous by nature but has always had trouble finding romantic love. Especially as I get older and everybody starts pairing off, it’s hard being practically the only single person in my group of friends when there’s always such an emphasis placed on the importance of these partnerships. It makes me feel so much better to see people talking about deprioritizing (is that a word??) romantic love!!
chefpst: TMC had me putting my all into a relationship I was not happy in. I struggled to become what was needed by my partner regardless of it actually being true to me. I still feel moments of wishing this had worked out and must remind myself how much happier I am just being me. I didn’t fail at the relationship I just developed a better one with myself.
